extendedIngredients.name: english muffins
extendedIngredients.original: 4 English muffins, split and lightly toasted
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 English muffins, split and lightly toasted
extendedIngredients.originalName: English muffins, split and lightly toasted

extendedIngredients.name: goat cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces fresh goat cheese, crumbled (about 1/2 cup)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces fresh goat cheese, crumbled (about 1/2 cup)

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: salt and freshly ground black pepper

title: Goat Cheese & Avocado Egg Sandwiches
instructions: Heat a small 8-inch skillet over medium heat. Add a pat of butter when it's hot enough to sizzle.Beat one egg in a small bowl. Pour into hot skillet and quickly swirl to coat the bottom of the pan in a thin layer.Sprinkle goat cheese over top of egg layer. This will probably take you about 30 seconds, at which point the egg is done.Use a thin spatula to gently fold the egg in half, then in half again to form a quarter circle. Transfer to warm muffin, season with salt and pepper, and top with 3 avocado slices.Repeat with remaining eggs as desired.

steps.step: Heat a small 8-inch skillet over medium heat.
Add a pat of butter when it's hot enough to sizzle.Beat one egg in a small bowl.

Pour into hot skillet and quickly swirl to coat the bottom of the pan in a thin layer.Sprinkle goat cheese over top of egg layer. This will probably take you about 30 seconds, at which point the egg is done.Use a thin spatula to gently fold the egg in half, then in half again to form a quarter circle.
Transfer to warm muffin, season with salt and pepper, and top with 3 avocado slices.Repeat with remaining eggs as desired.
